publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-1526 Derek Brownlee: Queen of the South—That the Parliament congratulates Queen of the South Football Club on reaching the semi-final of the Scottish Cup for the first time since 1950; notes that the team became full-time only last year; praises the club management and the entire squad on the progress that the team has made in the competition, and wishes the club continued success in the future. Supported by: Elaine Murray*, Nanette Milne*, James Kelly*, Alasdair Allan*, Murdo Fraser*, Patricia Ferguson*, John Lamont*, Robin Harper*, Karen Gillon*, Jamie McGrigor*, Bill Kidd*, Kenneth Gibson*
S3M-1526 Queen of the South (lodged on 10 March 2008) Ted Brocklebank*, Sandra White*, Jim Hume*, Jamie Hepburn*, Hugh Henry*
S3M-1526 Queen of the South (lodged on 10 March 2008) Gil Paterson*

S3M-1526 Derek Brownlee: Queen of the South—That the Parliament congratulates Queen of the South Football Club on reaching the semi-final of the Scottish Cup for the first time since 1950; notes that the team became full-time only last year; praises the club management and the entire squad on the progress that the team has made in the competition, and wishes the club continued success in the future. Supported by: Elaine Murray, Nanette Milne, James Kelly, Alasdair Allan, Murdo Fraser, Patricia Ferguson, John Lamont, Robin Harper, Karen Gillon, Jamie McGrigor, Bill Kidd, Kenneth Gibson, Ted Brocklebank, Sandra White, Jim Hume, Jamie Hepburn, Hugh Henry, Gil Paterson
S3M-1526 Queen of the South (lodged on 10 March 2008) Aileen Campbell*
S3M-1526 Queen of the South (lodged on 10 March 2008) George Foulkes*
